result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:02 AM Defendant Charles D Young in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the PTS violation report from defn's other case 22CF2689. Argument by the ADA for a cash bond and amendment to conditions. Re: prelim hearing - court explained the process to the defn. Court found good cause to waive time limits and set for a STC. Further argument re: bail violations. PTS appeared by C.H. who made stmts to the court. Court ordered cash bail of $125.00. Geographical restriction amended to not be at 2424 E. Washington Ave. Add condition of PTS to this case. Cash bond is set in the amount of $125 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: X GPS, X Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. All other conditions to remain. Defn taken into custody.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LG.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be on the 2400 block of E Washington Ave.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

3:58 PM Defendant Charles D. Young in court in custody.  Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek in court for Charles D. Young.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
